Since our switch to JDK 1.6 we experience strange behaviour of JUnit
on Red=
Hat (But not on Solaris, Suse or any of the Windows machines).

The output =
looks as follows and should explain everything:

----

Date: Fri Jan 18 02:=
00:05 CET 2008
OS: Linux 2.6.18-8.el5 i386
JVM: Sun Microsystems Inc. Java =
HotSpot(TM) Client VM 10.0-b19
JUnit Version: 4.4
Test cases:
    de.inside=
rs.cai.JobQueueTest.testGetPut() [665]
    de.insiders.cai.JobQueueTest.tes=
tPutGet() [666]
    [... lots of testnames here ...]
Executing 1254 test ca=
ses:
.........................................
[... last line repeated 28 t=
imes ...]
......................................
Finished JUNIT Test on Red=
Hat-Linux.
TEST FAILED

-----

Notice that: 
1) There is no F or E in the t=
ests, but the test failed?
2) That there are LESS than 1254 dots (more like=
 ~1230)

Can anybody explain that behavior to me?
PS: The same tests under =
different machines work, but the behavior
under Redhat is consistenly wrong=
 (but: not always after the same
amount of tests, sometimes it even works)
=
